creator: Herman Charles Merivale
description:
LibriVox recording of My Experiences in a Lunatic Asylum by Herman Charles Merivale.
Read in English by Carol Cotter; Lisa Reichert; shevyon4HIM
My Experiences in a Lunatic Asylum By a Sane Patient is a memoir by Herman Merivale relating, as the title suggests, his time in one of England's countryside asylums in the 1860's. the main subject - in this case, the author - is less than justly sentenced to a facility for the mentally disturbed. Literally crazy caricatures abound, prisoner and jailer alike. Lofty psychology experts float in and out of Merivale's stay, some more respectable than others but on the whole clueless to patients' real needs. Nurses withhold or too bountifully dispense medications, and wardens rely on inhumane tactics to illicit compliance. As our writer states, this time in British history was "when imprisonment was a form of cruelty which [needed] a new name." He highlights the horrific, hopeless conditions faced by any man, woman or child with even a mild case of depression or of schizophrenia or, for perhaps the most unfortunate souls, of ill-meaning family paying hefty sums to have them committed. (Summary by Lily Gross)
For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording.

For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org.
subject: librivox; audiobooks;psychology; england; medicine; study; health; human rights; mental; patients
